depressed anterior table frontal sinus f.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: 1. Depressed anterior table frontal sinus fracture on the right side.

right nasoorbital ethmoid fracture.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: 2. Right nasoorbital ethmoid fracture.

right orbital blowout fracture with entr.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: 3. Right orbital blowout fracture with entrapped periorbita.

nasal septal and nasal pyramid fracture.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: 4. Nasal septal and nasal pyramid fracture with nasal airway obstruction.

open reduction and internal plate and sc.context: Operation: 1. Open reduction and internal plate and screw fixation of depressed anterior table right frontal sinus.

transconjunctival exploration of right o.context: Operation: 2. Transconjunctival exploration of right orbital floor with release of entrapped periorbita.

open reduction of nasal septum and nasal.context: Operation: 3. Open reduction of nasal septum and nasal pyramid fracture with osteotomy.

gull-wing incision.context: A gull-wing incision was drawn over the forehead scalp.

inferiorly based forehead flap.context: An inferiorly based forehead flap was then elevated to the superior orbital rim.

supraorbital nerve.context: The supraorbital nerve was axing from the supraorbital foramen and the supraorbital foramen was converted to a groove in order to allow further inferior displacement and positioning of the forehead flap.

mucocele.context: A mucocele was removed from the frontal sinus and there was no significant destruction of the posterior wall.

sinus seeker.context: A sinus seeker was utilized and passed into the nasofrontal duct without difficulty.

frontal sinus obliteration.context: It was felt that the frontal sinus obliteration would not be necessary.

pericranial flap.context: At this point, the pericranial flap was folded in a fan-folded fashion on top of the plate and screw and hardware and fixed in position with the sutures to remain better contour of the forehead.

osteotomies.context: At this point, the nose was significantly shifted to the left and an open reduction of the nasal fracture was performed by osteotomies, which were made medially, laterally, and percutaneous transverse osteotomy of the nasal bone on the right side.

high septal deviation.context: There is a high septal deviation, which would not allow complete correction of the deviation.

local infiltration anesthesia.context: Local infiltration anesthesia 1% Xylocaine with 1:100,000 epinephrine was infiltrated in the conjunctival fornix of the right lower eyelid as well as the inferior orbital rim.

incision in the palpebral conjunctiva.context: An incision was made in the palpebral conjunctiva and capsular palpebral fascia beneath the tarsal plate preseptal approach to the inferior orbital rim was performed in this fashion.

entrapped periorbita.context: There was entrapped periorbita, which was released to the fractures, which were repositioned, but not fixed in position.

forced ductions.context: Forced ductions were performed, which demonstrated release of the periorbit satisfactorily.

conjunctival incision.context: The conjunctival incision was closed with an interrupted simple 6-0 plain gut suture.

nasal pyramid.context: The nasal pyramid was satisfactorily mobilized as well as the nasal septum and brought back to midline position with the help of a Boies elevator for the septum.

coronal incision.context: The coronal incision was closed with interrupted 3-0 PDS suture for the galea and deep subcutaneous tissue and the skin closed with interrupted surgical staples.

Mastisol Orthoplast splint.context: Mastisol Orthoplast splint was prepared after the Doyle splints were placed in the nose and secured with 3-0 Prolene suture and the nose packed with two Kennedy Merocel sponges.
